filter.inkscape:label: Fancy blur
filter.inkscape:menu-tooltip: Smooth colorized contour which allows desaturation and hue rotation

text.tspan: Command and Resource File Architecture VSXu 0.3.0
Â©2011 Vovoid Media Technologies, Jonatan Wallmander

flowRoot.flowPara: - Acts as a command processor. Asynchronous commands are allowed.
For instance - updates from the engine about current time, error messages etc.
- Hierarchial GUI, messages are passed and processed in each GUI element
- Commands from the rendering server (engine) are parsed and passed into the module hierarchy
- Acts as a command processor
- Commands coming from The Client can render different behaviour:
- load a state file or production (see resources on the right)
- list all available file resources
- list all available module names with description
- list the in and out parameters of a module
- create/delete instances of modules
- interconnect modulesâ parameters together
- get/set parameters
Engine message transfer protocols currently include:
- vsx_command_list (when used as dynamic library and linked with client)
- TCP/IP (standalone, both IPv4 and IPv6) currently limited to one conn. per server
- DLL's shared Objects not dynamically linked
- File system is searched by the engine on startup
- Thus MUST reside on the same hardware node as
the VSXu engine.
Resources (External Content)
- state files - containing all commands for getting the Engine into a state
- production files (.vsx) - containing a state file and all needed external resources. A packed (zip-like) format.
- images (png/jpeg)
- meshes
- sound files
- etc.
The resource files must reside on the same hardware node as the engine.
- Does not have to act on status messages
- Can feed states to the engine
- No need for GUI - can be scripting language (PHP/Python/Perl etc.)
- Telnet is possible to use - port is: 11030
- Note that Artiste doesn't enable the TCP/IP server in its own embedded VSXu Engine -
to run a standalone engine as server you need the "server" binary.
